Only approximately $50,000 in assets are held in John McCain's name. | signature = Mccainsig.svg | website = [http://mccain.senate.gov/public/ U.S. Senator John McCain: Arizona] | footnotes = }} '''John McCain''' (born [[August 29]], [[1936]] in the [[Panama Canal]] Zone) is a [[United States]] [[Senator]] from [[Arizona]]. He was been chosen by the [[United States Republican Party|Republican Party]] for the party's candidate in the [[United States presidential election, 2008]]. He is married to business woman [[Cindy McCain]]. McCain's father and grandfather served in the [[United States Navy|U.S. Navy]]. McCain went to the U.S. Naval Academy and later served during the [[Vietnam War]]. His plane was shot down. He was captured by the ''Viet Cong'', a name given to the [[Vietnam|North Vietnamese]] [[military]] who finally took over the entire country. While captured, he was called a "POW" (Prisoner of War). He was held in prison for several years and [[torture]]d, resulting in long-term damage to his body. ===Presidential campaigns=== Later, he became a U.S. Senator. He tried to get the Republican Party to choose him to be their candidate for [[President of the United States]] before, but [[George W. Bush]] got it. He tried again for it in [[2008]], and got chosen this time.
